body_html:
While the CUDA backend of Torch likely should work with CC 2.1, I dont think we guarantee that everything will work smoothly. For example some of the CUDA kernels we wrote might assume greater register file size than what is available via 2.1. So, expect a bumpy ride.

Saying that, I dont think using nvs5400m will be any more advantageous over using the CPU itself, it's not a fast GPU.
Just wanted to give you a heads-up.

body:
While the CUDA backend of Torch likely should work with CC 2.1, I dont think we guarantee that everything will work smoothly. For example some of the CUDA kernels we wrote might assume greater register file size than what is available via 2.1. So, expect a bumpy ride.

Saying that, I dont think using nvs5400m will be any more advantageous over using the CPU itself, it's not a fast GPU.
Just wanted to give you a heads-up.
